alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent; King; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 31 at 4:53AM CST until January 31 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing drizzle. Additional ice accumulations around a light glaze. For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing expected. Total ice accumulations between 0.25 and 0.35 of an inch, and total sleet accumulations of less than one inch. * WHERE...Dickens, Kent, King, and Stonewall Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM CST this morning. For the Ice Storm Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Significant ice accumulation on power lines and tree limbs may cause widespread and long-lasting power outages. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
